required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of Surufatinib Combination With Toripalimab in Patients With Recurrent Biliary Tract Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of Surufatinib Combination With Toripalimab in Patients With Recurrent Biliary Tract Cancer : a Phase Ⅱ Study

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase Ⅱ, open-label, single-arm study to assess the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of Surufatinib Combination With Toripalimab in Patients With Recurrent Biliary Tract Cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: A Phase 2, open-label, single-arm study to assess the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of Surufatinib Combination With Toripalimab in Patients With Recurrent Biliary Tract Cancer (intrahepatic or extrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, gallbladder cancer).

primary_outcome.description: The number of cases in which tumor size is reduced to PR or CR / the total number of evaluable cases (%). In the event of PR or CR, the subjects should confirm it no less than 4 weeks after the first evaluation. CT/MRI will be performed every 2 cycles of treatment by RECIST 1.1(each cycle is 21 days))

secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of Surufatinib Combination With Toripalimab in Patients With Recurrent Biliary Tract Cancer, patients by assessment of progression free survival (PFS) using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST v1.1).
The time interval between the start date of study drug and the date of death (any cause).

intervention.description: Surufatinib at a dose of 250mg Qd, with humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody Toripalimab injected intravenously 240mg per 3 weeks until disease progresses or unacceptable tolerability occurs.

overall_official.affiliation: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

facility.name: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University
